availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Golladay (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Montgomery County, Tennessee, native. Son of Samuel Golladay and Caroline Golladay. Married to Nancy Garnett Golladay in Trigg County, Kentucky, in December 1855. Father of James R. Golladay, Sarah E. Golladay, and Willie L. Golladay. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 332B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 147.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Roaring Springs Precinct, p. 134B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994056, Trigg County Marriages.
